c74object.name: timemap
c74object.description: Originally intended to create lists representing timing values as part of a system of gestural representation, timemap is an object that creates random lists of values with definable characteristics. The basic principle to start with a list of equidistant values (between 0 and 1 - and subsequently scaled if desired) and through randomisation and warping reach the values in the final list. The intention is to allow the creation of lists with shapes and characteristics that are to some extent determinate, but randomised within the given parameters. The values can either be generated independently, or in "streams", where the generated values are accumulated through addition or multiplication. A number of scalings are supported, appropriate to a range of musical parameters.

objarg.name: Random-amount
objarg.description:
The first argument sets the random amount as a float (0-1).
0 produces exactly equidistant values
1 produces entirely random values

objarg.name: Centre
objarg.description: The second argument sets the centre point as a float (0-1) around which to perform clumping.

objarg.name: Clumping-factor
objarg.description: The second argument sets the centre point as a float (0-1) around which to perform clumping.

method.name: int
method.description:
In the first inlet: Set the list Length and trigger an output.
In the seventh inlet: Set the Maximum Number of Retries as an int for generating each value before giving up (default 10).

method.name: float
method.description:
In the second inlet: Set the Random Amount as a float (0-1).
0 produces exactly equidistant values
1 produces entirely random values
In the third inlet: Set the Centre point around which to perform clumping as a float (0-1).
In the fourth inlet: Set the Clumping Factor as a float.
values between 0 and 1 warp away from the centre
1 produces no clumping
values larger than 1 clump towards the centre
In the fifth inlet: Det the Minimum Absolute Difference between consecutive values as a float (0-1) (default 0).
In the sixth inlet: Det the Maximum Absolute Difference between consecutive values as a float (0-1) (default 1).

method.name: random_order
method.description:
The random order message will turn on/off the random list order.
The message should be formatted as:
random_order / int
0 outputs the list in ascending order. 1 outputs the list in a random order.

method.name: Scaling
method.description:
The scaling message is used to set the scaling mode and ranges for timemap.
The message should be formatted as:
scaling / mode / min value / max value
The different modes are:
none, scale (linear scaling), log (logarithmic scaling), exp (exponential scaling), amp, pitch, div.
Note that the min and max intervals are in relation to the scaled output vals.

method.name: Stream
method.description:
In stream mode values are accumulated from one to the next. The initlal values are formed in the same way (with scaling if appropriate), but the final output is an accumulation of the scaled values from an initial point. The output is constrained within the given range. Note that it is possible to provide parameters that are impossible to realise (or improbable). Thus, the maximum retries value may be even more relevant in this mode.
The message should be formatted as:
stream / mode / initial value / minimum output value / maximum output value
mode 1 accumulates values by addition.
mode 2 accumulates values by multiplication.
